attributes.action: Save the London Olympics from becoming a laughing stock by calling for a redesign of the official logo.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since the unveiling of the official logo of the London Olympics and the associated news that this logo cost £400,000 there has been an overwhelmingly negative reaction to it. Comparisons have been drawn between it and the popular 80's TV show, Tiswas' logo. Other people have suggested that the logo looks akin to someone sneezing blancmange and custard on a piece of paper and writing London 2012 in it.

Either way, this logo is in danger of causing humiliation to Britain in the lead up to the Olympics.

I petition the Prime Minister to call for a redesign of this logo, maybe even to open the design to the public as some 'alternative' logos submitted to the BBC are of a truly different class.
This way we can have a logo which represents the spirit of the Olympics and one of which we can all be proud.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
